intro: Bupleurum togasii, commonly known as the Korean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or pale blue flowers. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Bupleurum togasii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
